column4: the sevenmachines ppa is dead as 64bit flash is in the partner repo
enable partner and install adobe-installer and you will get 64bit flash
Adobe flash is Adobe flash, its proprietary
lightspark isn't in the default repos
you can download the compressed archive for 64bit and copy the file to your browsers plugins directory
the ppa is dead as the packages it gave are now given in the partner repo, so its a pointless ppa
you can grab the 64bit compressed file, extract it and copy the libflashplayer.so (or watever its called) to your browser's plugins folder
Do I need to do anything with the other folders in the downloaded archive? Or just move libflashplayer to plug ins folders?
you only need the plugin file, the rest is not needed
Can you tell me the specific folder in which it should be placed? The one the others will link to?
will that cover chrome and chromium - both are installed
I don't use chrome, but I imagine it;s the same bag
Works for Chromium but not Chrome... any other ideas where I can find chrome folders?
as I said, I don't use the browser
